answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about what all you have had to face in life! I hope things improve from now on. Yes, Sjogren’s syndrome can cause fatigue and maybe decreased libido due to vaginal dryness. However, since you have had so many surgical procedures, you must get your iron and hemoglobin levels checked. Also, since you have auto-immune disorders possibility of diabetes too should be looked into.Since you have hysteron-salpingo-oopherectomy, there is a possibility that you have low estrogen. This can also cause decreased libido and fatigue. Please discuss this possibility with your gynecologist. Hormone replacement therapy will do wonders if this is the cause.Take care!

Hi,I am brand new to the medhelp world, and I just read this post of yours. I can relate to you so much! All of the back issues and surgery and chronic pain. I also have tremendous joint pain throughout my body, and neuropathy, and I could go on and on. I also have Chronic Major Depression that cycles with with the chronic pain which often affects my self esteem. Does that ever happen to you? And the low libido? What libido?? And yes, the fatigue!!! I get you so much! It is inexplicable. You wake up feeling as if you haven't just slept at all. Everything tires you out. There is never any energy. I am on a boatload of meds, but nothing helps the fatigue. The only thing that ever helped was Vit D. My levels were incredibly low, which I was told was common in Autoimmunes. Sunshine is the best way I get my Vit D, which helps boost your Serotonin levels, which helps the depression. That's been my best remedy for over 20 years. I would love to know how you beat the pain with such little medicine. I cannot walk, sit, concentrate, or hold a conversation without the pain screaming at me.

question: I am now 39 years old.  I have been diagnosed over the years with Sjogrens, Hypothyroid, spondylosis/arthritis in upper thoracic spine, degenerative disc disease, osteoarthritis of the knees, sleep apnea and major depression.  I have had positive Ana titters for years and had a positive anti Ro.  I've been in 3 major car accidents which have caused me to have slipped discs in cervical and thoracic areas.  I also have had many miscarriages and had identical twins that had Twin to Twin Transfusion Syndrome for which I was hospitalized for.  (My life or theirs kinda thing) they were born at 24 weeks 2 days gestation via emergency c-section and weighed about 1 pound each.  One twin died 12 hours after birth and the other had surgery the next morning and survived 36 hours.  In 2008 after 2 healthy births and 1 more miscarriage, I had to have a complete hysterectomy with oopherectomy (all is gone!).My point that I'm trying to get to is that I do not know what is causing what at this point.  I have severe pain which is managed by a great pain management doctor who keeps the meds to a minimum.  I take Synthroid 100mcg.  I also suffer from migraines, which I take Topomax 100 mg daily for as a preventative.  But my main complaints are MAJOR fatigue, and no libido.  I will have to sleep for 2-3 days in order to be productive for 1.  By the way, I was told that even with my CPAP machine I never went into REM sleep.  Is this from Sjögren's or depression or both?  My doctors work together, but none know that much about Sjögren's.
title: Complicated case with Sjögren's
